paper_abstract: Suppose that n > (log k)(ck), where c is a fixed positive constant. We prove that, no matter how the edges of K(n) are coloured with k colours, there is a copy of K(4) whose edges receive at most two colours. This improves the previous best bound of k(c'k), where c' is a fixed positive constant, which follows from results on classical Ramsey numbers.
paper_title: When is an Almost Monochromatic K(4) Guaranteed?
